description: From Latin phōca (“seal”) (from Ancient Greek φώκη (phṓkē))  +‎ -ine.

adjectives.description: phocine (comparative more phocine, superlative most phocine)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to a seal (or similar pinnipeds); seallike. [from 19th c.]
(zoology) A member of the subfamily Phocinae, comprising the "true" or "earless" seals.
examples: Phocines anchor their hands by flexing their fingers, digging them into the substrate, and then pulling their body forward by elbow and shoulder flexion.
